snippet: The Madison Square Garden Company, which runs the arena bearing its name in New York City, will honor presidential visits as part of its continuing renovation of the arena.
abstract: The Madison Square Garden Company, which runs the arena bearing its name in New York City, will honor presidential visits as part of its continuing renovation of the arena.
lead_paragraph: The Madison Square Garden Company, which runs the arena bearing its name in New York City, will honor presidential visits as part of its continuing renovation of the arena. Next week, the first of the building’s 20 “Defining Moments” will be unveiled, complete with special exhibits on the sixth-floor concourse. Two of the first 10 moments include Marilyn Monroe’s salute to J.F.K. and Bill Clinton’s presidential nomination in 1992.

headline.main: In New Madison Square Garden Exhibit, It’s All About the Presidents
